title: 114_s2870
content: There is an ongoing investigation into retaliation. The results of investigations into complaints of retaliation within the Department of Defense and the Armed Forces must be reported to the affected member, including whether the complaint was substantiated, unsubstantiated, or dismissed. The Secretary of Homeland Security must also provide similar reports for complaints made by members of the Coast Guard. In this section, "retaliation" is defined as specified by the Secretary of Defense in the strategy required by the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2016. Training for Department of Defense personnel on sexual assault trauma in individuals claiming retaliation in connection with reports of sexual assault in the Armed Forces. The Secretary of Defense ensures that Department of Defense personnel investigating retaliation claims related to sexual assault in the Armed Forces receive training on sexual assault trauma. Personnel include military criminal investigation services, Inspectors General offices, and command personnel assigned to investigate retaliation claims. The term "retaliation" is defined by the Secretary of Defense in accordance with the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2016. SEC. 5. Annual reports on sexual assault prevention and response efforts of the armed forces must include information on complaints of retaliation in connection with reports of sexual assault. Section 1631(b) of the Ike Skelton National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2011 is amended to include information on claims of retaliation in connection with reports of sexual assault in the Armed Forces, including details such as the nature of the complaint, gender of the complainant and the individual accused of retaliation, and the relationship between them. The amended Section 1631(b) of the Ike Skelton National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2011 requires information on claims of retaliation related to reports of sexual assault in the Armed Forces. Details include the nature of the complaint, gender of the complainant and accused individual, relationship between them, the official receiving the complaint, investigating organization, current status of the investigation, and results if completed. The amended Section 1631(b) of the Ike Skelton National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2011 requires information on claims of retaliation related to reports of sexual assault in the Armed Forces, regardless of whether it was an offense under the Uniform Code of Military Justice. The Sexual Assault Prevention and Response Office of the Department of Defense will establish metrics to evaluate efforts of the Armed Forces in preventing and responding to retaliation in connection with reports of sexual assault. Additionally, best practices will be identified and issued to enhance uniformity in these efforts.
